{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.05316v1", "title": "Size dependence of the properties of synthetic-antiferromagnet-based
  stochastic magnetic tunnel junctions for probabilistic computing", "summary": "Stochastic magnetic tunnel junctions (s-MTJs) are core components for
spintronics-based probabilistic computing (p-computing), a promising candidate
for energy-efficient unconventional computing. To achieve reliable performance
under practical conditions, the use of a synthetic antiferromagnetic (SAF)
free-layer configuration was proposed due to its enhanced tolerance to magnetic
field perturbations. For engineering the SAF s-MTJs, we systematically
investigate the properties of the SAF s-MTJs as a function of the junction
size. We observe that decreasing junction size leads to shorter relaxation
times, enhanced magnetic field robustness, and enhanced insensitivity to bias
voltage. These findings provide key insights toward high-performance
p-computers with reliable operation.", "main_category": "physics.app-ph", "categories": "physics.app-ph,cond-mat.mes-hall", "published": "2025-05-08T15:01:07Z"}
